Increased cultural exchange: The ability to communicate in a common language would facilitate cultural exchange, allowing people to learn about and appreciate different cultures more easily.
Economic benefits: A common language would make international trade and business more efficient, as companies could communicate more effectively with customers and partners around the world.
Education: Education would become more accessible, as students could learn from teachers and resources from different countries without language barriers.
Global unity: A common language would promote a sense of global unity, as people would be able to understand and connect with each other on a deeper level.
Preservation of languages: With a common language, the need for language preservation efforts would decrease, as the language would be more widely spoken and understood.
